page.title: 02WHITEHAVEN NEWS JUNE 27 1985
page.content:
FAIR SQUEEZED OUT MARKET TRADERS
Traders were not amused when fairground machinery took up some of their regular pitches at Cleator Moor last Friday.They felt it was unfair that they could not set up their stalls in their usual place opposite the co-operative store.A spokesman for Copeland Council,however said that they had a five year agreement with the fair operators that they could set up there for 2 weekends a year. Only 4 traders were left on the square after another 4 had decided they would not set up on another part of the site.One of them had come from Millom. Les Keenan,who operates a sweet stall on the local market.Some decided to staybut said that other traders as well as customers were angered by the inconvenience. by David Mingins
